meanings.definition: A person who is discontented or unhappy.
meanings.sent1: The group of repiners always found something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: The repiners in the office never seemed satisfied with anything.
meanings.sent3: The repiners at the party made everyone feel gloomy with their constant grumbling.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a repiner, always seeing the negative side of things.
meanings.sent5: The repiners in the storybook were always frowning and never seemed to smile.

meanings.definition: To feel or express discontent; complain.
meanings.sent1: He would often repiners about the long hours at work.
meanings.sent2: She repiners about the quality of the food at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The children would playfully repiners about having to clean up their toys.
meanings.sent4: The protesters began to repiners loudly about the unfair treatment.
meanings.sent5: As the storm approached, the villagers started to repiners about the dark clouds overhead.
